greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of integer partitions of n whose Heinz number (product of primes of parts) is divisible by n.
comment: The Heinz number of an integer partition (y_1,...,y_k) is prime(y_1)*...*prime(y_k). This gives a bijective correspondence between positive integers and integer partitions.
example: For example, the Heinz number of (3,2) is 15, which is divisible by 5, so (3,2) is counted under a(5).
xref: The Heinz numbers of these partitions are given by A324851.
Partitions whose product is divisible by their sum are A057568.
Partitions whose Heinz number is divisible by all parts are A330952.
Partitions whose Heinz number is divisible by their product are A324925.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jan 15 2020
